DOC.brief_summary: The overall aim pilot feasibility study determine 12-week moderate intensity exercise safely alleviate posttraumatic symptom premenopausal woman veteran . Specific aim study ; 1 . Determine feasibility , safety , tolerability 12-week moderate intensity exercise 2 . Explore potential therapeutic benefit 12-week moderate intensity exercise . Outcome data include posttraumatic depressive symptom . 3 . Explore potential therapeutic effect 12-week moderate intensity exercise comorbid pain syndrome quality life .
DOC.brief_title: A Pilot Exercise Study PTSD Women Veterans
DOC.criteria: 1 . Women veteran age 18 old 2 . Premenopausal woman childbearing potential negative pregnancy test 3 . DSM IVTR confirm PTSD relate traumatic event measure Clinician Administered PTSD Scale ( CAPS ) CAPS score least 45 4 . Relatively low sedentary life style 5 . Existing psychotropic medication allow stable dose 6 . Evidencebased psychotherapy ( e.g . Cognitive Processing Therapy Prolonged Exposure ) allow start study . However supportive educational group PTSDfocused allow . 1 . Other psychiatric diagnosis include bipolar disorder , schizophrenia , schizoaffective disorder , active substance dependence/abuse ( use past 1 month ) , obsessivecompulsive disorder , eat disorders.Comorbid major depressive disorder , dysthymia generalize anxiety disorder exclude . 2 . Serious psychopathology 3 . Actively suicidal homicidal 4 . Psychiatric hospitalization within past 30 day 5 . Active medical condition preclude use aerobic exercise uncontrolled hypertension , active musculoskeletal degenerative condition , symptomatic cardiovascular respiratory condition .
